name: Soundodger+
description: Soundodger+ combines the twitchiness of bullet hell shooters with the sonic thrills of rhythm games to create a wholly unique experience. Studio Bean has updated the original Adult Swim Games title with all-new tracks, controller support, and a fully-featured level editor. Plus, auto-generate stages from your own music library!Update!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP2, Vista, 7, 8 Processor: 2.33GHz or faster x86-compatible Memory: 512 MB RAM Storage: 180 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP2, Vista, 7, 8 Processor: 2.33GHz or faster x86-compatible Memory: 1 GB RAM Storage: 180 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Endless fun. You can do so much with the level editor and the soundtrack is great.
A fun and fast paced mixure of rhythm and bullet hell. Creating your own level is fun and has endless possibilitys
Heres a bullet hell you will enjoy. Fantastic level editor, Fantastic songs, Fantastic gameplay. Fantastic Practice mode. I cant get bored of it. Buy it.
Lovely concept, amazing execution, highly recommended for both shooter and rhythm game fans. I'm looking forward to any potential DLC down the line, which does not happen very often for me.

Great game here. I really recommend it to music lovers and shoot-em-up style dodging-loving gamers. There's a ton of levels to try to beat and they're all very challenging.  The slow-mo feature is a little bit gimmicky, you won't find yourself using it all too often.   It's honestly a fantastic little time-waster. You'll get your money's worth and more.       Visuals: 9/10   - beautiful visuals for what they are. Soundodger+ really nailed it.  Soundtrack: 10/10  - the music, of course, is fantastic. It's the main selling point.  Gameplay: 8/10  - a bit repetitive at times, but still engaging and fun gameplay.  Price: 9/10   - it's a pretty good value, no complaints about price here.

I like shmups. I like single screen systems. I like abstract graphics & mechanics. I like music generated/beat matched systems. A developer called Bean appears to have decided to make a game just for me. Just me.  Single screen, no player shooting, with various enemies flying around, launched in time with the light electronica that's playing. You avoid them until the music runs out. If you collide (and the collision is very generous in the player's favour), the current enemies go zooming off as the music fast forwards, and you lose score. To get yourself out of danger, you can press a key to temporarily slow down music to give breathing space to dodge.  Repeat until the music ends.  It is utterly wonderful. I haven't played a single screen shooter as pure & focused (and without ridiculous neon/bloom) in a long time.

An incredibly fun, minimalistic bullet-hell rhythm game, that I had a ton of fun playing around with. The levels in this game all feel natural and everything that fires at you fires at the right time. Think of Beat Hazard but with actual structure to it. Nothing about this game feels out of place and everything flows naturally.   The level editor, coupled with the tutorials from the developer himself, are very simple to grasp and use. And with the community making so many pretty good levels, there's plenty of content that this game provides. The auto-generated levels are not so good, as it's not even close to being as deep as the core levels are, basing more on the loudness of the track over any indtrumentation going on.  And of course, the soundtrack is great too! It has songs that I've had on since I bought the game and listen to regurlarly. The songs fit the game perfectly with their instrumentation and melodies and provide an amazing look when paired with the visuals.  In my short time with this game, I've had tons of fun with it. Everything is easy to grapple with and incredibly fun, I definitely recommend it for rhythm game fans.

If I were to use one phrase to describe this game, it would be 'sensory overload'. This game will put your reaction speed and ability to comprehend large amounts of information at one time to the test. The soundtrack is outstanding, and very expansive. I highly recommend this game.

This game was put together very well. Not only is the concept of the game of notes and music very good but the creativity was even better. For those of you who have played rock band or guitar hero, this game is very similar. Except for the fact that instead of hitting the notes you're trying to avoid them and instead of the notes coming in a straight line they come from circles that circle you. I definetly recommend that you get this game right now its only $3.99 or $4.99 for DLC, that will end on December 3rd, in which case it will go back to its original price, so get it while its on sale.

Relaxing, challenging, and deeper than it seems. I play this when I really need to shut off my brain for a bit.  The only thing I disliked was the jarring effects when I messed up, but this was easy to turn off.

im such a fan of editors games xD, Very recommended to buy it and play it! such awesome songs and nice basic levels, and you can test your skills on the advanced levels which are most of them Extremely haaaard! the Rhythm most of them are matched 100%, and you can create your own level, just select your own song and create your level! [Most of begineers cant create a level theres a tutorial of how to create a level] 10/10 would create another level xD

This is a Great Program/Game to play with your own music that you currently have in your music folders but the random generate is not so very good it dosen't go with the music's waves or beat, you have to do that part all on your own but really great game

Soundodger+  A game i really wanted to play and looks extremely fun, then found it like somebody eaten a sandwich, then vomited.

Soundodger felt like a fancy Flash tech demo to me. Dodge the shapes while a song is playing, big whoop.  Turn off the sound and you feel like you just went back in time, when these sort of games were still cool.  No, for your musical/rhythm games you should definitely try Audiosurf, Symphony or Bit.Trip Runner first.  [Rating: 65/100]
It's called Soundodger+  Because it dodges all the sound in your left speaker.

Fun gameplay, smooth UI, and great soundtrack.  If you're a fan of the bullet-hell/music genre, would highly recommend. If you're a cheapskate like myself, I would wait for a sale.  Either way, it's a nice little game with a small variety of music genre to sample from. And if by the off-chance you hate the songs it comes with, google for more user-created levels (if you don't want to make your own, that is)!

Playing this game is really cathartic at times, and at other times it's just plain fun. The soundtrack is awesome (I would highly suggest picking it up), and another cool feature is playing your own music with it, and while it doesn't seem too accurate, it is still super fun!

Certainly a fun way to play (with) my music collection. A pro-tip: learn to dance with your music (or make the cursor dance with it, more like), and you'll be like Reimu Hakurei (Touhou) in a nightclub. Been able to reliably score above 90% on most songs that way, or at least above 75% on the advanced versions.  The auto-gen is good enough to keep in-sync with the music close enough that my advice does work. Find a beat that works, and some seemingly suicidal moves will dodge damn-near everything, provided you move correctly, or can read the music well enough alongside the shots being fired.  EDIT: Additional pro-tip: Got your own music collection, legit or not? If you want it to play at all, convert it to mp3 at 44100Hz with a program like Format Factory or something. You know, just so you don't have to learn it the hard way like I did. Considering the music warps when you slow-down or get hurt, it makes sense to have it set like that.

Amazing Idea for a game. I have been working on a custom level using the editor and it is a lot of fun. The auto generation mode is cool because you get to listen to your music and play the game. The integrated levels are well made and the soundtrack is good.

If you're into electronic music and bullethell games this should be right up your alley. One of the most Synesthetic experiences i've had since Rez, every bullet and pattern intricately synchronizes to the music/levels. If you're planning to buy this to play your own music however, you might want to look elsewhere, as the auto generation for your own mp3s isn't very good. There is an editor though, so if you have the time, you can painstakingly make your own patterns to your music.

Soundodger+ is a difficult rhythm game about dodging objects in a small area while listening to some good music. If you have never played this game before, this game will make you dizzy. The songs are good, the gameplay is interesting, you can use your own music, and the level editor is filled with options. It is one of those games that I would wait for a sale to get.
TL;DR HOLY YES. Soundodger+ Is a game where you dodge the music in the game. It's different than a few games I've played and it's just awesome/

Ahh, Soundodger+! A breath of fresh air from all the triple A madness that goes on around the passing holidays. If you've ever played any arcade shooter, you already played soundodger. It's far from perfect and further from being original, but you will definitely forget about that once the music kicks in! You're a little circle that dodges the particles made by the music itself.   You dodge the sounds of music eminated by the likes of Austin Wintory, Mike Forst, and Disasterpeace! If you don't, the music will become mixed up and will transport ahead of your mistake, while keeping track of your percentages. You can also enter into a bullet-time like mode, but be warned; if you do it will affect your overall percentage! You can go a whole song in this mode, but you'll never complete with a 100% because of this.   It isn't without it's faults either, unfortunately! My main problem is it's repetitive nature, of course every game like this is going to be repetitive, but this is different. Like after a while (20 minutes I'd say) you're going to be bored with it. Not to mention the tracklist starts over when you hit the new levels! The game does have a level editor, which you can import songs and track it yourself, but the problem here is it's tedium. You'll be sitting at your desk, face smooshed into the screen, trying to get that one bullet into the perfect spot.  In reality, if you have time to kill, this game is right up your ally! It has a great soundtrack composed of some of the most talented personnel, ever. This game is meant to fill the gaps between shower and bed time or coffee and work!   Is it worth your money? I think so!
Really good and addicting :D

Bullet hell shooter minus shooting plus gameplay/soundtrack interaction plus hypnotizing visuals plus an amazing electro/dubstep/chiptune soundtrack. Comparable to Retro Evolved 2s pacifist mode I'd say. Definitely to be bought with the soundtrack, though if one despises one of the used music genres deeply, then that could add greatly to the frustration. It's a difficult game, in the best, most fun way possible.
This is a great game. It's innvovative, raging, and keeps you coming back for more. There's also an editor.
